text:
<|begin_of_text|><|start_header_id|>system<|end_header_id|>

You are a helpful assistant<|eot_id|><|start_header_id|>user<|end_header_id|>

What was proposed by LeCun and colleagues in 1989?<|eot_id|><|start_header_id|>assistant<|end_header_id|>

Restrictions on model capacity to prevent over-parametrized fully connected models from failing to generalize<|eot_id|>

<|begin_of_text|><|start_header_id|>system<|end_header_id|>

You are a helpful assistant<|eot_id|><|start_header_id|>user<|end_header_id|>

Why have convolution-based neural networks become the predominant deep learning method for image classification and generation?<|eot_id|><|start_header_id|>assistant<|end_header_id|>

Due to their parsimonious weight sharing, flexibility, and efficacy<|eot_id|>

<|begin_of_text|><|start_header_id|>system<|end_header_id|>

You are a helpful assistant<|eot_id|><|start_header_id|>user<|end_header_id|>

What is one of the key benefits of convolutional neural networks in terms of model capacity?<|eot_id|><|start_header_id|>assistant<|end_header_id|>

Parsimonious weight sharing allowing for larger inputs to be modeled with fewer parameters than traditional fully connected models<|eot_id|>

<|begin_of_text|><|start_header_id|>system<|end_header_id|>

You are a helpful assistant<|eot_id|><|start_header_id|>user<|end_header_id|>

What is another benefit of convolutional neural networks mentioned in the text?<|eot_id|><|start_header_id|>assistant<|end_header_id|>

Flexibility, as a single model may be applied to images of many sizes<|eot_id|>

<|begin_of_text|><|start_header_id|>system<|end_header_id|>

You are a helpful assistant<|eot_id|><|start_header_id|>user<|end_header_id|>

Why have nearly every state-of-the-art vision model since the early 90s been based on convolutions?<|eot_id|><|start_header_id|>assistant<|end_header_id|>

Due to their efficacy<|eot_id|>

<|begin_of_text|><|start_header_id|>system<|end_header_id|>

You are a helpful assistant<|eot_id|><|start_header_id|>user<|end_header_id|>

What modifications are added to the technique described in the last paragraph?<|eot_id|><|start_header_id|>assistant<|end_header_id|>

A 3x3 Gaussian convolution starting with σ=2.4 and ending with σ=0, and positional jittering using cropped regions after around 200 iterations.<|eot_id|>

<|begin_of_text|><|start_header_id|>system<|end_header_id|>

You are a helpful assistant<|eot_id|><|start_header_id|>user<|end_header_id|>

How is the random input a_0 constructed?<|eot_id|><|start_header_id|>assistant<|end_header_id|>

The random input a_0 is constructed as a normal distribution with μ=0.7 and σ=1/20.<|eot_id|>

<|begin_of_text|><|start_header_id|>system<|end_header_id|>

You are a helpful assistant<|eot_id|><|start_header_id|>user<|end_header_id|>

What is the purpose of finding the gradient g in the image generation process?<|eot_id|><|start_header_id|>assistant<|end_header_id|>

The purpose of finding the gradient g is to update the input by gradient descent.<|eot_id|>

<|begin_of_text|><|start_header_id|>system<|end_header_id|>

You are a helpful assistant<|eot_id|><|start_header_id|>user<|end_header_id|>

How does positional jittering work in the image generation process?<|eot_id|><|start_header_id|>assistant<|end_header_id|>

Positional jittering works by applying Gaussian convolution and gradient descent only to a subset of the input, while leaving the rest of the input unchanged.<|eot_id|>

<|begin_of_text|><|start_header_id|>system<|end_header_id|>

You are a helpful assistant<|eot_id|><|start_header_id|>user<|end_header_id|>

What is the output O(a_0, θ)_i used for in the image generation process?<|eot_id|><|start_header_id|>assistant<|end_header_id|>

The output O(a_0, θ)_i is used to calculate the difference between some large constant C and the output at the desired index i.<|eot_id|>
